subject: todo tests in JUnit (think Perl)
msgSnippet: I sent the following email to junit@objectmentor.com.  By posting this email I am hoping to receive additional guidance and insight from the JUnit community.
messageBody:
I sent the following email to junit@.... By posting
this email I am hoping to receive additional guidance and insight
from the JUnit community. Please copy any responses to
jcarpenter@....
______________________________________________________
We are finding that there are times when it may be desirable to check
into source control code that is not fully implemented. The tests
may be defined, but the corresponding class implementation may not be
complete.

Perl's standard framework has the concept of a todo test. A simple
enough way to notate such a test in JUnit would be to name a method
within a test todoBlah, rather than testBlah. To safely go down this
road, it is desirable to extend JUnit to report on what todo tests
are in the code base in addition to the normal tests. I am
considering writting such an extension and contributing it back to
the JUnit project. Unfortuantely, I don't know where in the JUnit
code base to start.

Can you provide guidance as to what classes would need to be changed
to support this functionality? Do you have any suggestions
to improve the idea? Ideally this can fit into JUnit's normal
extension framework.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Jimmy Carpenter
jcarpenter@...
__________________________________________
Erik Meade kindly responded with the following:
*******************
Jimmy,

I think the class you want to start with is junit.framework.TestSuite.
Take a look at the constructor which accepts a Class. I believe this
is where the tests get loaded by reflection...

If you want more input I would suggest you post this to the JUnit
group,
which you can sign up with from the junit.org page, and/or a forum on
http://sourceforge.net/projects/junit/

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
